We suggest that only single Zn1-ion plays the role of catalytic center. The newly found differences between the two subfamilies could guide the design of new drugs against S. aureus, an important pathogenic micro-organism.

Re-expression of GLO1 restores miR-137-mediated suppression of melanoma cell proliferation.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

name: glyoxalase I

reactome.name: Aerobic respiration and respiratory electron transport

smpdb.name: Pyruvate Decarboxylase E1 Component Deficiency (PDHE1 Deficiency)

summary: The enzyme encoded by this gene is responsible for the catalysis and formation of S-lactoyl-glutathione from methylglyoxal condensation and reduced glutatione.  Glyoxalase I is linked to HLA and is localized to 6p21.3-p21.1, between HLA and the centromere. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
